TopicTitle: FanWork Fridays: A Detailed Map of Kerbin

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/301cb0bc17ca76a396dc75e2651dee4d/tumblr_inline_n23e4osZyb1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/23f640e50a8b595f1a9236435f7d9089/tumblr_inline_n23e51UElo1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71685-Most-Detailed-Kerbal-Border-Map-in-History"><strong>Pds314</strong></a> recently stitched together screenshots from <a href="http://www.kerbalmaps.com/"><strong>Kerbalmaps.com</strong></a> and turned them into what has been deemed “the most detailed Kerbal border map in history.”* Here’s a quick explanation from the creator:</p>

<p><em>"Most countries have a real-life analog except for those on the continent of Southwest Cerima. The analog may or may not be accurate or obvious and the name may be partially or wholly based off of the analog or a previous name for the analog or something related to it. There are 81 countries that consider themselves independent and 90 or so named regions, including countries and various territories such as islands owned by countries."</em></p>

<p>Detailed? Yes.</p>

Kinda looks like a Risk gameboard. Now that I think about it...

*Insert maniatic laughter*

Wow, really, really nice! I love analogs and I always like comparing planets and rocket parts to real life counterparts... would be interested in seeing which countries on this correspond to the real countries in the world.

Kinda looks like a Risk gameboard. Now that I think about it...

*Insert maniatic laughter*

VASSAL Mod, perhaps?

The question then becomes whether to do Risk or Axis and Allies......

My son was asking for a map of Kerbin like that the other day; definitely going to have to get his opinion on it.
Great, now all we need to do is create several house, road, and car models, some which correspond to their biome, and generate cities!
